page.title: 09Lead mining in Eryrys
page.content: The earliest records of lead mining in Eryrys are 1295, when the Earl of Surrey recruited skilled lead miners from Eryrys to work in Devon. In the 18th century several mining companies operated in Eryrys and continued to produce ore according to demand. By the early 19th century mining was expanding, much of Eryrys was built. Records show that the population was over 1000. Miners came from other areas including Cornwall, their names are still evident in the area today. Work was hard and poorly paid. Miners supplimented their wages by collecting heather to make brooms for sale. The mines had closed by the begining of the 20th century, evidence of their earlier importance can still be seen in old buildings, ruined cottages, spoil and shafts, often capped.
